fields.label: Capacity in which you are completing this form
Do you have an email address?
have you already completed a notification of premises using form GD58

fields.infoText: We need your consent before using email to communicate

fields.label: Read about the risks of using email
fields.infoText:
HMRC takes the security of personal information very seriously.

The main risks of using email that concern HMRC are as follows.

Confidentiality/privacy - there is a risk that email sent over the internet may be intercepted.

Confirming your identity - it is crucial that we only communicate with established business contacts at their correct email addresses.

There is no guarantee that an email received over an insecure network, like the internet, has not been altered during transit.

We will desensitise information wherever possible, for example by only quoting part of any unique reference numbers.

fields.label: By clicking yes you confirm that you have a clear understanding and acceptance of the risks associated with email, and that you are content for us to send information concerning your business details.
fields.shortName: Confirm consent to use email communication

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: Provide your email address below if you consent to communicating by email

fields.infoText:
You also need to complete a notification of premises using form GD58. 

 This is available from the [gov.uk website](https://www.gov.uk/)

fields.infoText:
As you are a partnership, you also need to apply for each partner to be included on the Gaming Duty register using form GD57 

This is available from the [gov.uk website](https://www.gov.uk/)

fields.label: Self Assessment Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR)
fields.helpText: Your UTR is a 10 digit number. If you are already registered for Self Assessment, you will find your UTR on the front page of your tax return or any Self Assessment calculations we have sent you.

fields.label: Corporation Tax reference
fields.helpText: Your Corporation Tax reference is a 10 digit number. It can also be called a Unque Taxpayer referce (UTR). You can find it on the form CT603 'Notice to deliver a company Tax return' or other official documents issued by HMRC. Depending on the document , the reference may be printed next to the headings 'Tax Reference', 'UTR' or 'Official Use'. If the number is more than 10 digits, you only need to enter the last 10 digits, ignoring any prefix numbers.

fields.label: Have you already completed the Gaming Duty group treatment form GD60?

fields.infoText:
As you are a representative member of a group for Gaming Duty purposes, you also need to complete form GD60. 

 This is available from the [gov.uk website](https://www.gov.uk/)

fields.helpText: This is the 9 digit reference number issued by HM Revenue & Customs when you registered for VAT, for example 123456789. It will be shown on the VAT 4 Certificate of Registration.

fields.label: Text box
fields.helpText: This is the default text field. It is set to mandatory and will only accept 0-9, Aa-Zz and '-.

fields.label: Text box including special characters
fields.helpText: This text field is set to mandatory and allows special characters to be entered without restriction

fields.label: Limited character text box
fields.helpText: This text field is set to mandatory and limits input to a maximum of 10 characters including spaces. The user cannot continue if they enter more than 10 characters

fields.label: Optional text box
fields.helpText: This text field can be left blank and does not require any input to enable the user to continue.

fields.infoText: Hint text sits above a form field and provides supporting contextual help.
The type of text field used to provide contact details can be set to meet the needs of the form owner. For example whether a field is optional or mandatory.

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: Enter a valid email address with no spaces. e.g name@example.com
fields.errorMessage: Enter a valid email address with no spaces. e.g name@example.com

fields.label: Positive whole number text box
fields.helpText: This field only accepts positive whole numbers and is limited to 11 digits. If a user enters a negative value or a decimal place, they will receive an error message.

fields.label: Sterling box
fields.helpText: This is formatted to receive values in Sterling, including pounds and pence and is also limited to 11 digits. Negative values can be entered by using a minus(-) symbol. Commas can be used to display larger numbers.

fields.infoText: gForms are able to perform calculations using values entered on the same or previous pages. The following examples demonstrate the addition and multiplication expressions.

fields.label: Enter any number
fields.helpText: Addition will be demonstrated in the following field through an automated calculation.

fields.label: Automated field showing the number entered + 2
fields.helpText: Multiple fields can be added together

fields.label: Multiplication is also possible, this field shows the number entered * 2
fields.helpText: This box is read only, users are unable to edit this field and it is automated

fields.infoText: This is a standard date component frequently used to declare the start and end dates of a return period.

fields.label: Start/end date
fields.errorMessage: Enter the return period start date using the correct format

fields.label: End date
fields.helpText: There is some validation on this field, which prevents users submitting an end date prior to the start date
fields.errorMessage: Enter the end date as a period later than the start date

fields.infoText: Date entries can be customised based on requirements, such as limiting them by number of days, months and years.
This is the file upload feature. Accepted file types include: documents, spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, images, and PDFs.

Multiple choice options are available. They can be static or branch off into separate journeys depending on the user input.
fields.helpText: This is a static example and will not affect the journey

fields.label: This is an example of a Yes/No choice. In this case, when the 'Yes' radio button is selected additional pages will be generated.

fields.infoText: Pages can be generated in direct response to previous user input. For example, this page is displayed if 'Yes' was selected on the previous page. If 'No' was selected the journey would continue without this page.

fields.label: This is an example of a checkbox that can expand into more components if selected.
You can then have multiple components within the checkbox
You can also have multiple checkboxes
